results.title: Association between Metformin Use and Risk of Total Knee Arthroplasty and Degree of Knee Pain in Knee Osteoarthritis Patients with Diabetes and/or Obesity: A Retrospective Study

results.title: Metformin for Knee Osteoarthritis in Patients With Overweight or Obesity: A Randomized Clinical Trial.
results.text_hl: Objective: To evaluate the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Patellofemoral_Pain_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D046788 @@@knee pain@@@ at 6 months in @SPECIES_9606 @@@participants@@@ with symptomatic @DISEASE_Osteoarthritis_Knee @DISEASE_MESH:D020370 @@@knee osteoarthritis@@@ and @DISEASE_Overweight @DISEASE_MESH:D050177 @@@overweight@@@ or @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@.

citations.NLM: Pan F, Wang Y, Lim YZ, Urquhart DM, Estee MM, Wluka AE, Wolfe R, Cicuttini FM. Metformin for Knee Osteoarthritis in Patients With Overweight or Obesity: A Randomized Clinical Trial. JAMA. 2025 Apr 24;():. PMID: 40274279

results.title: Metformin for knee osteoarthritis with obesity: study protocol for a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial
results.text_hl: It is hypothesised that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, compared with placebo, will (1) reduce @<m>DISEASE_Patellofemoral_Pain_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D046788 @@@knee pain@@@ (primary hypothesis); (2) improve clinical outcomes (stiffness, function and health-related quality of life) and that (3) the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Patellofemoral_Pain_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D046788 @@@knee pain@@@ and function will be associated with changes in @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ and metabolic biomarkers and/or @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@.

citations.NLM: Lim YZ, Wang Y, Urquhart DM, Estee MM, Wluka AE, Heritier S, Cicuttini FM. Metformin for knee osteoarthritis with obesity: study protocol for a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial BMJ Open. 2023 Dec 9;13(12):e079489. PMID: 38070903
